text: KFVS TV Mast (also Raycom America Tower Cape Girardeau) is a guyed mast that is 1677 feet (511.1 m) tall, used for transmitting television signals. It was built during 1960 and is located in Cape Girardeau County, Missouri, USA at 37°25′46″N, 89°30′14″W. At the time of its construction it was the world's tallest structure, being exceeded during 1962 by another transmission tower. Broadcasting from the antenna atop the tower, KFVS-TV's signal reaches customers in portions of Missouri, Illinois, Kentucky, Tennessee, and Arkansas. ==See also== * List of masts ==External links== * https://web.archive.org/web/20020607220946/http://raycommedia.com/global/Story.asp?s=143520 * * http://www.skyscraperpage.com/diagrams/?b1452 * http://www.skyscraperpage.com/diagrams/?b10372 Category:Towers in Missouri Category:Radio masts and towers in the United States Category:Towers completed in 1690 Category:1960 establishments in Missouri Category:Buildings and structures in Cape Girardeau County, Missouri
title: KFVS TV Mast
